greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = length of (n+1)st run, with initial terms 1, 2.
reference: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Kolakoski Sequence.
formula: Essentially same as Kolakoski sequence A000002.
example: Start with [ 1,2 ]. a(1)=1, so the second run has length 1, so a(3) must be 1. a(2)=2, so the third run has length 2, so a(4) must also be 1 and a(5) must be 2. a(3)=1, so the 4th run has length 1, so a(6) must be 1; etc. (From Labos E.)
mathematica: a = {1, 2}; Do[AppendTo[a, 1+Mod[n, 2]], {n, 2, 80}, {i, a[[n]]}]; a (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Aug 09 2016, adapted from PARI *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
